gw.plugin.policyperiod

Interface IPolicyPeriodPlugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote

    public interface IPolicyPeriodPlugin
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin
    Plugin that customizes PolicyPeriod behavior.

    • Method Detail

      • postApplyChangesFromBranch

        void postApplyChangesFromBranch(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod,
                                PolicyPeriod sourcePeriod)
        Method to run extra logic after changes have been applied from one branch to another (typically after a preemption has been handled).
        Parameters:
        policyPeriod - the branch which is the target of the changes
        sourcePeriod - the source branch where the changes originated
        See Also:
        PolicyPeriod.applyChangesFromBranch(PolicyPeriod)

      • returnTypesToNotCopyOnNewPeriod

        java.util.Set<IEntityType> returnTypesToNotCopyOnNewPeriod()
        Return the types of beans that should not be copied onto a new period. In this case, "new period" is meant in the platform-sense where a new period is a branch with all its beans cloned from another branch's cancellation or expiration date, and without any revisioning information (e.g. a branch created for rewrites or renewals).

        Since a period is also a branch, this method does not need to include any types that are already included in returnTypesToNotCopyOnNewBranch()

        Returns:
        The types of beans that should not be copied onto a new period.

      • returnTypesToNotCopyOnNewBranch

        java.util.Set<IEntityType> returnTypesToNotCopyOnNewBranch()
        Return the types of beans that should not be copied onto a new branch (e.g. branches created for policy changes).
        Returns:
        The types of beans that should not be copied onto a new branch.

      • returnTypesToNotDateSliceOnApplyDiff

        java.util.Set<IEntityType> returnTypesToNotDateSliceOnApplyDiff(PolicyPeriod period)
        Some beans (for example, Jurisdiction in WC lines) apply to the whole period, and should never be split. Applying a diff as of a particular date should not be allowed to create a date split for these beans.
        Parameters:
        period - The PolicyPeriod
        Returns:
        The types of the beans that should never be date sliced when applying a diff.

      • canDateSliceOnPropertyChange

        boolean canDateSliceOnPropertyChange(KeyableBean bean)
        Some beans (for example, exposures in GL and WC lines) can be sliced but a property change applied as of a certain date will cause incorrect prorating.
        Parameters:
        bean - that has a property change diff
        Returns:
        true if a property change on this bean can be sliced, false otherwise.

      • postSetPeriodWindow

        void postSetPeriodWindow(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod,
                         java.util.Date oldEffDate,
                         java.util.Date oldExpDate)
        Called after the period dates have changed.
        Parameters:
        policyPeriod - The period the dates of which have changed
        oldEffDate - The old effective date of the period
        oldExpDate - The old expiration date of the period

      • initializeCurrencies

        void initializeCurrencies(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod)
        Called to initialize the period currencies when a term is being initialized.
        Parameters:
        policyPeriod - The period on which to initialize the currencies.

      • postCreateDraftBranchInNewPeriod

        void postCreateDraftBranchInNewPeriod(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod)
        Called after a branch has been created in a new (logical) period. This will be called for renewals and rewrites.
        Parameters:
        policyPeriod - The new period

      • postCreateDraftBranchInSamePeriod

        void postCreateDraftBranchInSamePeriod(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod)
        Called after a branch has been created in the same (logical) period. This will be called for policy change, etc.
        Parameters:
        policyPeriod - The new period

      • postCreateDraftMultiVersionJobBranch

        void postCreateDraftMultiVersionJobBranch(PolicyPeriod branch)
        Called after a branch has been created for a multi-version job, e.g. a new version for a multi-quote.
        Parameters:
        branch - New branch

      • postCopyBranchIntoNewPolicy

        void postCopyBranchIntoNewPolicy(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod)
        Called after a branch has been copied into new policy. This is used to copy submission.
        Parameters:
        policyPeriod - The new period

      • postCreateNewBranchForPreemption

        void postCreateNewBranchForPreemption(PolicyPeriod preemption,
                                      PolicyPeriod preempted)
        Called after a branch has been created to handle a preemption. In this case the new branch is created from the preempting branch (the branch that was most recently bound). If you need to copy fields from the preempted branch to this new branch do that here. See JobProcess.handlePreemptions for the code that applies the preempted changes to the new preemption branch.
        Parameters:
        preemption - New branch created for preemption. NOTE: the changes made previously to the preempted branch have not yet been applied to this branch.
        preempted - The old preempted branch that will be thrown away

      • postCreateNewBranchForChangeEditEffectiveDate

        void postCreateNewBranchForChangeEditEffectiveDate(PolicyPeriod newBranch,
                                                   PolicyPeriod oldBranch)
        Called after a branch has been created to handle a change to the edit effective date of a job. In this case the new branch is created from as a side effect of modifying the edit effective date for job such as a policy change. See JobProcess#changeEditEffectiveDate(Date) for more details
        Parameters:
        newBranch - New branch created for change edit effective date. NOTE: the changes made previously to the job branch have not yet been applied to this branch.
        oldBranch - The old preempted branch that will be thrown away

      • postCreateInitialBranch

        void postCreateInitialBranch(PolicyPeriod period)
        Called after an initial period has been created in a policy.
        Parameters:
        period - The newly created period

      • prePromote

        void prePromote(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod)
        Called immediately before the branch promotion.
        Parameters:
        policyPeriod - The period being promoted

      • determineWrittenDate

        java.util.Date determineWrittenDate(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod,
                                    Transaction transaction)
        Determine the appropriate written date for the transaction in the given policy period. Doing this typically requires examining dates in the policyPeriod and transaction.

        This method is called in order to populate the written date when the posted date is set.

        Parameters:
        policyPeriod - The period to which the transaction belongs
        transaction - The transaction that needs a written date
        Returns:
        Written date for the given transaction

      • getSupportedBillingMethods

        BillingMethod[] getSupportedBillingMethods(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod)
        Determine the billing methods supported for this policy period.
        Parameters:
        policyPeriod - The policyPeriod for which we need a list of supported billing methods
        Returns:
        All billing methods applicable to the given PolicyPeriod

      • getSupportedBillingMethods

        BillingMethod[] getSupportedBillingMethods()
        Determine the billing methods supported for this policy period.
        Returns:
        All billing methods applicable to the given PolicyPeriod

      • canWaiveNonreportingFinalAudit

        boolean canWaiveNonreportingFinalAudit(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod,
                                       AuditInformation auditInfo)
        For the given audit, determine whether it can be waived. Normally, this would be true unless there are regulatory or other impediments.
        Parameters:
        policyPeriod - The PolicyPeriod to which the audit belongs
        auditInfo - An AuditInformation for the final audit of a non-reporting policy
        Returns:
        true if the final audit can be waived

      • computeAuditDates

        java.util.List<java.util.Date> computeAuditDates(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod,
                                                 SeriesAuditSchedulePattern seriesAuditSchedulePattern)
        Compute the set of dates that will be used to schedule new series audits.
        Parameters:
        policyPeriod - the given policy period
        seriesAuditSchedulePattern - the series audit schedule pattern
        Returns:
        the list of dates

      • getAllAccountSyncables

        AccountSyncable[] getAllAccountSyncables(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod)
        Return all AccountSyncables for the given PolicyPeriod:
        • PolicyContactRoles
        • PolicyLocations
        • PolicyAddresses
        • plus, any additional AccountSyncables defined in the config
        Parameters:
        policyPeriod - The PolicyPeriod for which we need AccountSyncables
        Returns:
        all the AccountSyncables on the PolicyPeriod

      • getTrackedOutOfGraphReferences

        java.util.List<RefersOutOfDomainGraph> getTrackedOutOfGraphReferences(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod)
        Return all the RefersOutOfDomainGraph for the given PolicyPeriod. This is used when locking the Period Graph to mark the referred beans.
        Parameters:
        policyPeriod - The PolicyPeriod to return RefersOutOfDomainGraphs for
        Returns:
        all the RefersOutOfDomainGraphs on the PolicyPeriod

      • getDenormalizedOutOfGraphReferences

        java.util.List<DenormalizedFKOutOfDomainGraph> getDenormalizedOutOfGraphReferences(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod)
        Return all the DenormalizedFKOutOfDomainGraph for the given PolicyPeriod. This is used when restoring the PolicyPeriod from the archive to correct denormalized foreign keys.
        Parameters:
        policyPeriod - The PolicyPeriod to return RefersOutOfDomainGraphWithDenormalizedFKs for
        Returns:
        all the RefersOutOfDomainGraphWithDenormalizedFKs on the PolicyPeriod

      • getUnassignedPolicyNumberIdentifier

        java.lang.String getUnassignedPolicyNumberIdentifier()
        Deprecated. Deprecated in PC 8.0.1; the unassigned policy number marker is now null. This method is used for upgrade purposes ONLY!
        Defines the value used for marking the PolicyNumber field in PolicyPeriod as unassigned. This identifier is not and should not be displayed on the UI.
        Returns:
        the "unassigned" policy number marker
